I am a PhD student at Yale University in the lab of Matthew Simon. I have developed a number of bioinformatic tools for processing and analyzing nucleotide recoding RNA-seq (NR-seq) experiments. NR-seq is a class of methods for probing the dynamics of RNA synthesis and degradation. 

## Education

---

#### **Yale University | New Haven, CT | August 2019 - Present**

PhD in Molecular Biophysics and Biochemistry

#### **Centre College | Danville, KY | August 2015 - May 2019**

B.S. in Physics, minor in Math

## Experience

---

#### **Programming in R (since 2019)**

Scripting ([example repo](https://github.com/isaacvock/EZbakRsuite_paper_code))

R package development (most notably, [EZbakR](https://github.com/isaacvock/EZbakR))

Shiny app development (e.g., interactive [TimeLapse-seq simulator](https://isaacvock.shinyapps.io/tl_sim/))
  
#### **Snakemake pipeline development (since 2021)**

[fastq2EZbakR](https://github.com/isaacvock/fastq2EZbakR): Flexible processing of NR-seq data.

[NRsim](https://github.com/isaacvock/NRsim): Simulating NR-seq data to test analysis strategies and pipelines.

[AnnotationCleaner](https://github.com/isaacvock/AnnotationCleaner): Assembling annotations using StringTie and some custom scripts.

[THE_Aligner](https://github.com/isaacvock/THE_Aligner): Aligning almost any kind of RNA-seq data.

[PROseq_etal](https://github.com/isaacvock/PROseq_etal): PRO-seq/ChIP-seq/ATAC-seq pipeline.
  
#### **Other experience**

Python (since 2021; used throughout Snakemake pipelines listed above)

C (since 2023; [example repo](https://github.com/isaacvock/Learning_C))

Pytorch (since 2023; [example repo](https://github.com/isaacvock/Learning_Pytorch))
